definition: the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat

sentences.english: I will not let the Lingzhi endured pain.
sentences.chinese: 不會讓我承受痛苦的凌遲。

definition: to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
